title: What are some resources that could help me get started? - Quora

response.answer_text: For a regular microelectronics thing I'd say pick up an Arduino with a WiFi shield, but absent any knowledge of electronics I'd say a Raspberry Pi is a better bet.  There's also Intel® Edison.  The Pi and the Edison are better for n00bs because they're capable of running code in Python and Ruby, which are considered much easier languages to learn than C++.  Technically Arduino can run Python, but the processor has a lot less memory and Python is interpreted rather than compiled, so the interpreter takes up a bunch of space that could be used for more code.

I do not suggest you start with some hardware platform such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi or Edison, although you can do this for some basic usage concept, but do not limit your ideas. You can view some architecture paper from website such as Bosch Bosch Media Service which contains automative to industrial iot. Hope to help you
